title: Next-gen Sony A7S II now does 4K on the inside
text:
Sony unveils the a7S II camera ° 11th Sep 2015 , The new a7S II is a step up from its predecessor, with it now being capable of internal 4K video recording through XAVC S codec at a bit rate of up to 100mbps. It also retains the max ISO of 409,600. Apart from enabling large video recording, Sony employed ... 
Sony A7s II: The Best Low-Light Mirrorless Camera Now Records 4K Video Onboard ° 11th Sep 2015 , Last year, Sony ... The A7S II boasts the same 12-megapixel sensor as the A7S, with the same 100-469,600 ISO range that can be expanded to 50-409,600. But for those times when you’re still stuck shooting with a slow shutter, the A7S II now has the ... 
Sony's new A7S II shoots 4K video in the dead of night ° 11th Sep 2015 , REVIEWED.COM CAMERAS Sony's New A7S II Shoots 4K Video In the Dead of Night For example, the A7S II will now feature 5-axis image stabilization similar to the A7 II, offering users considerable protection from blurry shots. The autofocus system should also ...

Perhaps more importantly, the A7S II has a few important features that will make a big difference for photographers and videographers alike. First off, the camera now has the excellent 5-axis in-body image stabilization ... 
Sony’s mega ISO monster updated: A7S II gets 4K internal recording, 5-axis IS, better pro video features ° 11th Sep 2015 , The third family member of Sony A7-series of full-frame mirrorless cameras has ... it required a cumbersome external capture device to record the 4K signal out of the HDMI port. Now, the A7S II can capture and record 4K Ultra HD video all in-camera ... 
Sony adds 5-axis stabilization, improved video to high-sensitivity Alpha A7S II camera ° 11th Sep 2015 , Continuing its “Mark II” rollout of its Alpha A7-series full-frame mirrorless cameras, Sony introduced the A7S II ... For photography, the A7S II has an improved autofocus system. It now has 169 AF points, so it’s faster and more accurate than ... DID YOU KNOW THIS: Next Next, Inc. (later Next Computer, Inc. and Next Software, Inc. and stylized as NeXT) was an American computer company headquartered in Redwood City, California, that developed and manufactured a series of computer workstations intended for the higher education and business markets. NeXT was founded in 1985 by Apple Computer co-founder Steve Jobs after he was fired from Apple. NeXT introduced the first NeXT Computer in 1988, and the smaller NeXTstation in 1990. Sales of the NeXT computers were relatively limited, with estimates of about 50,000 units shipped in total. Nevertheless, its innovative object-oriented NeXTSTEP operating system and development environment were highly influential. ... Gen Gen ( ) is a video game character from the Street Fighter fighting game franchise. He is an elderly Chinese martial artist and assassin with white hair and beard who wears a purple changshan with red slippers. He made his debut as a computer-controlled opponent in the original Street Fighter and later resurfaced as a playable character in the Street Fighter Alpha sub-series. nGen first appears in the original Street Fighter (1987) as the second opponent the player faces from China in the single-player tournament (the first one being Lee). Gen is portrayed as an elderly martial artist who according to the game's backstory, works as an assassin as well. nGen would resurface as a playable ... How about these:
